message_1: A group of 6 friends decided to play a game of Red vs Blue. In this game, each player is either on the Red team or the Blue team. Determine the minimum number of players required to ensure that there are at least 3 players on the same team or 3 players on different teams.
message_2:
To determine the minimum number of players required to ensure that there are at least 3 players on the same team or 3 players on different teams, we can use the Pigeonhole Principle. The Pigeonhole Principle states that if there are n pigeonholes (in this case, teams) and m > n pigeons (players), then at least one pigeonhole must contain more than one pigeon.

In this case, we have 2 teams (Red and Blue) and we want to find the minimum number of players (pigeons) required to ensure that there are at least 3 players on the same team.

If we have 3 players, it's possible that they could be split evenly between the two teams (2 players on one team and 1 player on the other). However, as soon as we add a 4th player, it's guaranteed that one of the teams will have at least 3 players, since there are only 2 teams for the players to be divided into.

Therefore, the minimum number of players required to ensure that there are at least 3 players on the same team or 3 players on different teams is 4.
